main event: Three bright, white and red lights in boomerang-shaped formation were observed by witnesses for 7-8 seconds at Marietta & Duncannon, Pennsylvania on December 11, 1960.
interesting points: The lights were last seen 1 mile away from the witnesses., The object displayed unusual speed and maneuverability which led to its classification as unidentified., A pilot reported seeing a meteor at a similar time and location, but his belief was that the object could be an illusion., The sighting was recorded at 2210 hrs and lasted between 7-8 seconds, which was brief yet notable., Analysis suggested it was probably not a balloon or conventional aircraft.
sighted object: three bright, white and red lights in a boomerang formation
witness description: Witnesses on the ground observed the lights intermittently.
